title: Potential graph - resistor and battery clockwise

content.question: The figure shows a circuit comprised of a battery and a resistor. Four labeled points in the circuit are indicated as well. Which of the following graphs best represents the electric potential as a function of position along the circuit path <math alttext="A B C D A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ABCDA</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows a line graph in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Position,” and the five letters A, B, C, D, and A are indicated from left to right and evenly spaced. The vertical axis is labeled “Potential,” and is divided into two equal units. From left to right, the potentials are as follows for each of the five positions. At the first position A, potential is 0 units. At position B, potential is 0 units. At position C, potential is 1 unit. At position D, potential is 1 unit. At the second position A, potential is 0 units.

The figure shows a line graph in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Position,” and the five letters A, B, C, D, and A are indicated from left to right and evenly spaced. The vertical axis is labeled “Potential,” and is divided into two equal units. From left to right, the potentials are as follows for each of the five positions. At the first position A, potential is 1 unit. At position B, potential is 1 unit. At position C, potential is 0 units. At position D, potential is 0 units. At the second position A, potential is 1 unit.

content.answer: The figure shows a line graph in a coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Position,” and the five letters A, B, C, D, and A are indicated from left to right and evenly spaced. The vertical axis is labeled “Potential,” and is divided into two equal units. From left to right, the potentials are as follows for each of the five positions. At the first position A, potential is 1 unit. At position B, potential is 1 unit. At position C, potential is 0 units. At position D, potential is 0 units. At the second position A, potential is 1 unit.
